content.text:
# List of gene prediction software

This is a list of software tools and web portals used for gene prediction.
{| class="wikitable sortable"
! Name
! Description !! Species !! References
|-
| [https://github.com/sagnikbanerjee15/Finder FINDER]
| Automated software package to annotate eukaryotic genes from RNA-Seq data and associated protein sequences
| Eukaryotes
|
|-
|[https://omics.informatics.indiana.edu/FragGeneScan/ FragGeneScan]
| Predicting genes in complete genomes and sequencing Reads ||Prokaryotes, Metagenomes
|
|-
|[http://atgpr.dbcls.jp ATGpr]
| Identifies translational initiation sites in cDNA sequences || Human||
|-
|[https://github.com/hyattpd/Prodigal Prodigal]
|Its name stands for Prokaryotic Dynamic Programming Genefinding Algorithm. It is based on log-likelihood functions and does not use Hidden or Interpolated Markov Models.
|Prokaryotes, Metagenomes (metaProdigal)
|
|-
| [http://bioinf.uni-greifswald.de/augustus/ AUGUSTUS]
| Eukaryote gene predictor || Eukaryotes ||
|-
| BGF
| Hidden Markov model (HMM) and dynamic programming based ab initio gene prediction program || ||
|-
| DIOGENES
| Fast detection of coding regions in short genome sequences ||  ||
|-
| Dragon Promoter Finder
| Program to recognize vertebrate RNA polymerase II promoters ||  Vertebrates ||
|-
|[https://services.healthtech.dtu.dk/service.php?EasyGene-1.2 EasyGene]
|The gene finder is based on a hidden Markov model (HMM) that is automatically estimated for a new genome.
|Prokaryotes
|
|-
| [http://eugene.toulouse.inra.fr/ EuGene]
| Integrative gene finding || Prokaryotes, Eukaryotes ||
|-
| [http://www.softberry.com/berry.phtml?topic=fgenesh&group=programs&subgroup=gfind FGENESH]
| HMM-based gene structure prediction: multiple genes, both chains || Eukaryotes ||
|-
| [http://genoweb.toulouse.inra.fr/FrameD/FD FrameD]
| Find genes and frameshift in G+C rich prokaryote sequences || Prokaryotes, Eukaryotes ||
|-
| [http://www.jstacs.de/index.php/GeMoMa GeMoMa]
| Homology-based gene prediction based on amino acid and intron position conservation as well as RNA-Seq data
|
|
|-
| GENIUS II
| Links ORFs in complete genomes to protein 3D structures ||  Prokaryotes, Eukaryotes||
|-
|[http://genome.crg.es/software/geneid/ geneid]
| Program to predict genes, exons, splice sites, and other signals along DNA sequences || Eukaryotes ||
|-
| [http://stormo.wustl.edu/src/GenParser/ GeneParser]
| Parse DNA sequences into introns and exons ||  Eukaryotes||
|-
| GeneMark
| Family of self-training gene prediction programs || Prokaryotes, Eukaryotes,
Metagenomes
|
|-
| GeneTack
| Predicts genes with frameshifts in prokaryote genomes || Prokaryotes ||
|-
| [http://hollywood.mit.edu/genomescan.html GenomeScan]
| Predicts the locations and exon-intron structures of genes in genome sequences from a variety of organisms, GENSCAN server is the GenomeScan's predecessor || Vertebrate, Arabidopsis, Maize||
|-
| GENSCAN
| Predicts the locations and exon-intron structures of genes in genome sequences from a variety of organisms || Vertebrate, Arabidopsis, Maize||
|-
| GLIMMER
| Finds genes in microbial DNA || Prokaryotes ||
|-
| [https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/glimmerhmm/ GLIMMERHMM]
| Eukaryotic gene-finding system || Eukaryotes ||
|-
| GrailEXP
| Predicts exons, genes, promoters, polyas, CpG islands, EST similarities, and repeat elements in DNA sequence || Human, Mus musculus, Arabidopsis thaliana, Drosophila melanogaster ||
|-
| mGene
| Support-vector machine (SVM) based system to find genes || Eukaryotes ||
|-
| mGene.ngs
| SVM based system to find genes using heterogeneous information: RNA-seq, tiling arrays || Eukaryotes ||
|-
| [https://sites.stat.washington.edu/thompson/Genepi/MORGAN/Morgan.shtml MORGAN]
| Decision tree system to find genes in vertebrate DNA || Eukaryotes ||
|-
| [https://github.com/PapenfussLab/bionix BioNIX]
| Web tool to combine results from different programs: GRAIL, FEX, HEXON, MZEF, GENEMARK, GENEFINDER, FGENE, BLAST, POLYAH, REPEATMASKER, TRNASCAN ||  Prokaryotes, Eukaryotes||
|-
| [https://www.fruitfly.org/seq_tools/promoter.html NNPP]
| Neural network promoter prediction ||  Prokaryotes, Eukaryotes||
|-
| [https://www.fruitfly.org/seq_tools/splice.html NNSPLICE]
| Neural network splice site prediction ||  Drosophila, Human||
|-
| [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/orffinder/ ORFfinder]
| Graphical analysis tool to find all open reading frames||  Prokaryotes, Eukaryotes||
|-
| [http://pedagogix-tagc.univ-mrs.fr/rsat/RSAT_portal.html Regulatory Sequence Analysis Tools]
| Series of modular computer programs to detect regulatory signals in non-coding sequences ||  Fungi, Prokaryotes, Metazoa, Protist, Plants||
|-
| [https://github.com/deprekate/PHANOTATE PHANOTATE]
| A tool to annotate phage genomes.  ||Phages
|
|-
| SplicePredictor
| Method to identify potential splice sites in (plant) pre-mRNA by sequence inspection using Bayesian statistical models || Eukaryotes ||
|-
| VEIL
| Hidden Markov model to find genes in vertebrate DNA Server || Eukaryotes  ||
|}
See also
* Gene prediction
* List of RNA structure prediction software
* Comparison of software for molecular mechanics modeling
References
